game

Class GameContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.GameContext

  • public class GameContext
extends java.lang.Object
    The GameState class represents the current state of the Connect4 game. It holds the game board, the current player and the current result of the game, allowing for the retrieval of the game's status at any point.

    This class is useful for encapsulating the game's state, making it easier to manage and pass around during game play. The board is stored as a deep copy to prevent unintended modifications.

    Since:
    2024-09-23

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameContext

        public GameContext(char[][] board,
                   Player currentPlayer,
                   GameResult result)
        Constructs a new GameContext with the given board, current player, and game result. This constructor performs a deep copy of the provided board to prevent external modification. The initial board is a 2D character array, where each element represents a cell on the game board. The board typically has 6 rows and 7 columns, with empty cells initialized to '␀'.
        Parameters:
        board - A 2D character array representing the game board. This array is deep-copied.
        currentPlayer - The player who is currently taking their turn.
        result - The current result of the game (e.g., WIN, DRAW, or CONTINUE).

    • Method Detail

      • getBoard

        public char[][] getBoard()
        Returns the current game board. The board is a 6x7 grid of characters. Initially, the board contains empty cells represented by the null character ('␀'). During gameplay, these cells are replaced by player tokens, such as 'R' for Player 1 and 'B' for Player 2.
        Returns:
        A 2D character array representing the current state of the game board.

      • getCurrentPlayer

        public Player getCurrentPlayer()
        Returns the current player.
        Returns:
        The Player object representing the player whose turn it is.

      • getResult

        public GameResult getResult()
        Returns the current game result.
        Returns:
        The GameResult object representing the current game status, which can be WIN, DRAW, or CONTINUE.

      • setBoard

        public void setBoard(char[][] board)
        Sets the game board.
        Parameters:
        board - A 2D character array representing the new state of the game board.

      • setCurrentPlayer

        public void setCurrentPlayer(Player currentPlayer)
        Sets the current player.
        Parameters:
        currentPlayer - The new current player.

      • setResult

        public void setResult(GameResult result)
        Sets the current game result.
        Parameters:
        result - The new result of the game (e.g., WIN, DRAW, CONTINUE).
